title: RestClient with Oidc Token (OidcClientRequestReactiveFilter) is NOT failing when Token is wrong/unauthorized
body:
### Describe the bug

              Given an existing valid realm
              And a failure on token creation (wrong credentials etc.)
              When we call the testClient
              Then Actual url NEVER been called (correct)
              BUT We get valid Response object (not a failure) with status code = 0 (WRONG STATE)



### Expected behavior

Expected:    Instead, the testClient should fail with an Exception

### Actual behavior

    We get valid Response (not failure) with status code = 0 (WRONG STATE)


### How to Reproduce?

Option 1 --> Run this: https://github.com/spirostz/quarkus-client-oidc/blob/main/src/test/java/org/acme/ClientTest.java

Option 2:

1. Create a Restclient with @RegisterProvider(OidcClientRequestReactiveFilter.class)
2. Make sure that a running keycloak's realm is configured in Quarkus (`quarkus.oidc.auth-server-url`)
3. Set the token credentials to something invalid eg. `quarkus.oidc-client.credentials.secret=wrong_key`
4. Inject and call the client, what url you are calling it doesn't matter

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

MINGW64_NT-10.0-22621 spirospc 3.3.3-341.x86_64 2022-01-17 11:45 UTC x86_64 Msys

### Output of `java -version`

openjdk version "17" 2021-09-14 OpenJDK Runtime Environment (build 17+35-2724) OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 17+35-2724, mixed mode, sharing)

### GraalVM version (if different from Java)

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

2.16.6.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

By Using this` quarkus.log.level=DEBUG` we can actually see the failures from the try to get valid Token

eg `2023-04-06 15:22:12,719 DEBUG [io.qua.oid.cli.run.OidcClientImpl] (vert.x-eventloop-thread-3) Default OidcClient has failed to complete the client_credentials grant request:Â  status: 401, error message: {"error":"invalid_client","error_description":"Invalid client or Invalid client credentials"}`
